summary: The document is a confidential memorandum from the Chief of the Domestic Collection Division to the Chief of the Miami Field Office, dated 11 March 1977. It discusses an unidentified man linked to the Cuban and Soviet Embassies in Mexico City during October 1963, whose photograph appeared in the Warren Commission report on the assassination of President Kennedy. The memorandum seeks assistance in identifying the man, later identified by a former Cuban intelligence officer as Yuri, a KGB officer. Yuri was fluent in English and Spanish and served as a troubleshooter for a Cuban group in Moscow in 1964.
key_findings: The document is related to the investigation of President John F. Kennedy's assassination.
An unidentified man associated with the Cuban and Soviet Embassies in Mexico City in October 1963 was later identified as Yuri, a KGB officer.
Yuri was fluent in English and Spanish and acted as a troubleshooter for a Cuban group in Moscow in 1964, not attending classes with them.
The man's photograph was published in the Warren Commission report and circulated by journalists critical of the Commission.
